title: Make git verifier more permissive - only check task-generated changes
description:
Git verifier currently fails if there are any uncommitted changes. This is too strict because:
1. Users may have pre-existing uncommitted work
2. Only changes made during task execution should be verified

Proposed approach:
1. At task START: snapshot current uncommitted files (git status --porcelain)
2. At task END: check for uncommitted files
3. Only flag files that are NEW since start (weren't in initial snapshot)

This allows users to have dirty working directories while still catching agent-created uncommitted changes.

Files to investigate:
- internal/verify/ - verification system
- internal/engine/engine.go - where verification is triggered

Edge cases to consider:
- Files modified (not new) during task - should these be flagged?
- Files deleted during task
- Files in .gitignore
closed_reason: Git verifier now captures baseline of uncommitted files at engine start. Only new uncommitted changes are flagged during verification. Pre-existing changes are ignored.
